page.title: 16ROADS
page.content: {B1012 ACCESS TO SOUTH WOODHAM FERRERS The expansion of S.W.F. as a new town greatly increased the traffic flow on the B1012.It was found to carry 13,000 vehicles per 16 hours, an overload of 44%,(taking 9,000 vehicles per 16 hour day as the maximum desirable working load). Planning permission was granted in July 1979. The contract was awarded to Laing Construction for Â£2.2m. The single carriageway road to be 3.8km (2.3 miles) long, taking an estimated load of 12,000 vehicles per day rising to 17,000 by the late 1990s. The major portion of land required was arable and pasture land. A small area of common land was also used. Compulsory purchase was necessary on some plots. It was necessary to demolish two properties West of Hawk Hill. Construction took 16.5 months. The MOT intends to classify this road A132.
